intro: Pedicularis evrardii, commonly known as the Evrard's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic growth habit. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling small lanterns. It thrives in cool, moist habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
